fields.summary: Add query syntax help to search page.
Space Admin - Trash - Needs pagination to display more than 22 items

fields.description: When searching, users should be able to search for a version comment and have the corresponding page/CEO show up as a result. This just involves appending the version comment text to the searchable text.
fields.summary: Version comments should be indexed for inclusion in searches

fields.description: The 'storePage' method in the Remote API should support adding version comments. This would have to be added to the RemotePage or RemotePageSummary classes as another attribute, which could possibly break existing implementations.
fields.summary: Add ability to add a "version comment" when editing a page via the Remote API
Allow plug-ins to create custom help areas for the notation guide

fields.description:
I've attached the log from the server for the failed export. 

When it failed, I got a plain/non-confluence 500 error page, stating the there was an error exporting to PDF.
fields.summary: Cannot export Confluence 1.4 User Guide to PDF

fields.description:
A single line version comment has a paragraph tag around it when displayed in the version history, which means there's lots of extra (unnecessary) space around it. This should be removed.

The extra line break should also be removed when there is no version comment.
fields.summary: Version comments have surrounding paragraph tags when not necessary
Thumbnails of images and videos should be shown in search results

fields.description: There is no reason why anonymous users should be able to create new spaces or administrate a Confluence installation. These permissions should be removed from the interface.
fields.summary: Remove the ability for anonymous users to be assigned "Create Space" and "Administrate" global permissions

fields.description: Add conditional get to PluginResourceDownload -- see ResourceDownload for how to do this, but note that plugins need to be able to report their most recent activation time for this to work (or plugin resources need a last modified time)
fields.summary: Conditional-get for plugin resources
Regression: user must use correct case when inlining image attachments

fields.summary: When attempting to backup the database confluence terminates with java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

fields.description:
The change history has too much whitespace.

We should render the change comments in RenderMode.suppress(RenderMode.F_FIRST_PARA), so that it only gets paragraph tags when absolutely necessary. This would make most histories a lot more neat and compact.
fields.summary: Page history change comments render with extraneous paragraphs

fields.description:
I stored a Map which in turn contained a joda DateTime object using the BandanaManager against a Space. Apparently, Bandana doesn't like DateTimes and now Confluence dies at birth. This is caused by programmer error, but Confluence should be a little better at recovering from this kind of problem. As it is, I think I will have to restore from a backup to get my server back into any kind of working order. Thankfully it was just a test instance...

There are two exceptions I can find. They are listed below. Here is the dump I get at the browser:

fields.description:
When creating a new SMTP Mail Server configuration the value of user name field is already populated with a previously entered value.

For example, let's assume that I have created an SMTP configuration A with the user name value 'webmaster@hostname.domain'. When I try to create configuration B the value of user name field is being populated as 'webmaster@hostname.domain'. When I try to change the value to something else, it doesn't work (update seems to be ok but while opening the configuration page again the user name value isn't changed). I don't know if the value is coming from a cache or a database.

This happens even after I have deleted all the configuration and then try to create a new one from scratch.

This is problematic as the current value is wrong (i.e., wrong SMTP account) and it cannot be changed; currently Confluence is not able to send any mails.
fields.summary: User Name field's value populated while creating new SMTP configuration

fields.description:
Last month I uploaded a combination of files to our instance of Confluence v1.4.3 and the attachments icon for each file displayed correctly; i.e. Word files show a word icon, PDF files show a pdf icon.

This month I noticed that the pdf icon no longer displays and instead the file.gif icon keeps coming up.  I then tried uploading the same file(s) to our other instance of Confluence (1.4.2) and it has the same problem.  The source code of the page shows pdf.gif for the older files and file.gif for the newer ones.

A few days before this stopped working I was playing with the Confluence console and export/import of spaces in an attempt to easily copy attachments between spaces (to no avail) on v1.4.3 of Confluence - so this might explain why something has gone funny in this instance, except that I can't see how it would have changed the PDF icon for v1.4.2?
fields.summary: File icons incorrect for PDF attachments

fields.description:
It would be great if there was a way to have plugins advertise XWork or Servlet links which allow administration at a global and space level. Currently, you can write XWork actions to perform administration, but there is no simple way to link to them.

At minimum, it would be good to have the potential for an 'admin' link in the plugin's details in the main Admin section. However, it would be nice if plugins could specify other links in both the global and space-level administration sections. And while you're at it, it would make my day if you could dynamically add an extra tab to the 'Browse Space' view for the non-admin types around.
fields.summary: Plugins hooking into the admin UI

Implementation will probably involve adding an "attachmentContentType" field to the Lucene index that we can then search on.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4249].
  {panel}

It would be great to add an extension to the current WYSIWYG functionality so that you could enable a 'meeting mode' to allow viewers of a page to see the WYSIWYG edits in real time as they happen.

This would be brilliant for meetings.

A button allowing anyone else to take control of the edits would also be very nice.

This would turn Confluence into a much more powerful collaboration tool.

Searching should run over the RSS headlines where RSS macros are used.

fields.description:
When we check for # of licensed users, we pretty much load all active users into memory. This makes it SLOOOOOOW, and we do it every time we save or update a page.

It's not critical that the license-check is always or immediately performed, or that it updates in real-time with new users, just that it kicks in 'soon enough' to annoy people who are over their license limit. Thus we should perform the count in a background thread, pass all "are we licensed?" queries until we have a precise result, then cache the result for a while before we have to do the count again.
fields.summary: Licensing check stops the world - potentially for a long time.

fields.description:
Currently the 'watch this space' icon on each page is confusing, not the least because it's the opposite meaning to the favourites icon - With favourites, it's an "on/off" switch, whereas for the watch link it's an icon that describes the state you're not in.

We should try the following.

Make the icon a three-state switch.

1. envelope with grey cross (grey because red would draw too much attention to the icon) indicating the page isn't being watched.
2. envelope with a green tick indicating the page is being watched
3. envelope with a globe indicating the space is being watched

Clicking on the icon will transition it between all three states.

Because un-watching a space is an action that goes beyond the scope of the current page, we should pop up a Javascript "Are you sure?" alert if the user transitions away from state 3, but _ONLY_ if that was the state of the icon when the page was first loaded (so we don't get annoying alerts from someone just clicking through from 2 back to 1)
fields.summary: Change the "Watch this space" icon on a page to a three-state button

How ever if you enter http://wiki.company.com/confluence/login.action page directly, and you try to login with your credential, it giver temporary redirect to an server IP address which is not correct behaviour (as server IP address can be private one (like from 192.168.x.x segment). It should give you back base url which is configured in wiki.

fields.description:
Hello,
  We have published an RSS feed from Confluence, and the central IT department on campus, who will be configuring their system to read our RSS feed reports a problem to me:

"I went ahead and defined your test feed indicated below in our test instance and it's not rendering properly.  I see one possible reason for that problem.  If you view the source of the feed, the second line reads: 

<rss version="0.92">

so the portal is trying to render it using a .92 stylesheet, but looking at the content, it looks more like rss version 2.0.  Can you get confluence to specify rss version 2.0 in the header? "

Can this update be performed?
fields.summary: RSS feed needs be version 2.0 instead of 0.92

fields.description:

fields.description:
The active/deactive flag now disappears but we keep activate and deactivate functionality by relating it to the USE_CONFLUENCE permission . 

The notion of 'activity' will no longer be a separate value stored in a property set. Instead, if a user is active, they have the USE_CONFLUENCE permission. If the user is deactivated, the user is removed from all groups and loses the USE_CONFLUENCE permission. When we deactivate a user we will also store a propertyset, indicating the previous memberships that a user possessed, which can later be called upon to make life easier for the administrator if the user is reactivated.
fields.summary: Activate/deactive user now manipulates the user's relation to USE_CONFLUENCE permission
Add content status to RemotePage bean

fields.description:
Backup Export should only export entites within Confluence's database, ignoring entities from other external repositories. 

Confluence will store users in the new database structure (CONF-4232) and, in some cases, might have remaining osuser tables also (CONF-4233).
fields.summary: Global Export should only export users in Confluence's database.

fields.description:
This should probably be an upgrade task. It is possible that some users will have specific OSUser solutions in place and will not want the upgrade task to run. We should identify a way for users to avoid running this upgrade task if it is unwanted, or not use an upgrade task but simply provide a porting utility.

Users who do not want to migrate immediately will be introduced to a migrating plan, to help them port their OSUser dependent code to Atlassian User.
fields.summary: Create utility to move Entites from OSUser tables into Atlassian User tables.

fields.description: We will be creating our own set of database tables for users and groups and using Hibernate to access them. This has already been specified and discussed in Atlassian User planning documents.
fields.summary: Create new rdbms structure for a Hiberate implementation of Atlassian User

fields.description:
A number of changes have been suggested for the administration UI of users and groups. This issue can organise them.

* Clicking on 'Manage Users' will no longer automatically load all users into memory and dump them into a paginated list. Instead we will present a search panel for generating an Atlassian User query.
** The notion of repositories should also be represented in the search panel. If an administrator chooses to search across multiple repositories we will probably use a progress bar, as it will most likely be a bigger task to generate such results in a delegated scenario.
** pagination for every listing of a user, group, or user to group relation. The first page of any query is shown, then the user may choose to access further information. This maps to an API call for the nextPage in the PagingIterator.
* Reporting on the total number of users in an LDAP system will bring back a value between 0 to 99. If the number exceeds 99 it will be turned as '100 or more'. This is due to a limitation in LDAP server support for rfc 2696. It means that we our reports will have to inform the user about this in a friendly manner. We will not implement our own count of the number of users in an LDAP system, as this means we will be filling gaps left by LDAP systems in our own software and it simply won't perform efficiently.


More planning is required here but this is a start.
fields.summary: Entity Administration improvement

fields.description: PermissionDelegate checks are failing on a match of the remote class to a key, matching the expected class name, in a hashmap, mapping the delegate. Dont use reflection or, if reflection must be used, use isAssignableFrom(..) or something like that.
fields.summary: PermissionDelegates are stored via keys based on class names

fields.description:
We will no longer use PaginationSupport when paging users or groups. The UserPicker should be refactored to

* use the PagingIterator in Atlassian-User
* use the new query system for searches. All searches should be repository specific, so we will need to also provide a selectable menu of user repositories.
fields.summary: UserPicker should use the new query system and the PagingIterator
edit user properties should not be available in profile for Read Only user account

fields.description:
GroupPicker ([JIRA@USER-49]) - should be used instead of drop down lists in the UI which load all groups for a user. 

It should be assumed that a user can belong to 1000s of groups - as such we can no longer load all groups and put them into HTML select boxes.

Do something similar to the current UserPicker.
fields.summary: Replace group select menus with a GroupPicker
When moving a page to another space links that use anchors get prefixed with the old spaces key

fields.description:
Using the workaround for rendered User-Macros as proposed in CONF-3887 and CONF-2293 there comes up a new issue: renderConfluenceMacro won't render the Wiki-Content in the current context. So the following macro will produce two different results:

User Macro:
------------------------------
#set($wiki="{blog-posts:3|content=titles}")
#set($globalHelper=$action.getGlobalHelper())
#set($renderer=$globalHelper.getWikiStyleRenderer())
#set($context=$content.toPageContext())
#set($xhtml1=$renderer.convertWikiToXHtml($context, $wiki))
#set($xhtml2=$globalHelper.renderConfluenceMacro($wiki))
<dl>
<dt>Version 1</dt>
<dd>${xhtml1}</dd>
<dt>Version 2</dt>
<dd>${xhtml2}</dd>
</dl>
----------------------------

While Version 1 correctly lists the news of the current space Version 2 renders the {blog-posts}-macro as if it got previewed in a Global Template, i. e. at least not with the News of the current space. It would be great if renderConfluenceMacro would render this correctly as the rendered macros will then shrink to:

#set($wiki=$body)
#set($globalHelper=$action.getGlobalHelper())
#set($xhtml=$globalHelper.renderConfluenceMacro($wiki))
${xhtml}

instead of

#set($wiki=$body)
#set($globalHelper=$action.getGlobalHelper())
#set($renderer=$globalHelper.getWikiStyleRenderer())
#set($context=$content.toPageContext())
#set($xhtml=$renderer.convertWikiToXHtml($context, $wiki))
${xhtml}

which in addition produces a failure when previewed in the Global Templates.
fields.summary: renderConfluenceMacro seems to render content "out-of-context"

fields.description:
Using the workaround proposed in CONF-3887 and CONF-2293 to render User-Macro-Body contents there is a problem. Rendering the body will always embed the content into a HTML-paragraph-element (

). Example: User Macro bgcolor: ----------------------- #set($color=$param0) #set($wiki=$body) #set($globalHelper=$action.getGlobalHelper()) #if($content) #set($renderer=$globalHelper.getWikiStyleRenderer()) #set($context=$content.toPageContext()) #set($xhtml=$renderer.convertWikiToXHtml($context, $wiki)) #else #set($xhtml=$globalHelper.renderConfluenceMacro($wiki)) #end ${xhtml}## -------------------------- Will render the Wiki-content: {bgcolor:red}Red{bgcolor}, {bgcolor:green}Green{bgcolor}, {bgcolor:blue}Blue{bgcolor} to:

Red

Green

Blue

 instead of: Red Green Blue If there is no way to just remove the content from beeing embedded into a paragraph-element (for compatibility reasons) there should be at least an additional method with an additional argument like "boolean inline".
fields.summary: Can not render wiki content as inline text using user macros

fields.description:
The new release of GMail (2005-10-03) supports Auto-save.  Or as they say:

Auto-save
We spent 20 minutes writing this entry, and then the browser crashed. Good thing there's auto-save. It saves. Automatically.

I've had my browser crash when writing a large page in Confluence.  It sure would be nice if it had been auto-saved every 20 seconds or so.

fields.description:
When I moved my page from one space to another all of my [~username] links to user profiles got prefixed with the old spaces key - and hte key then showed up in my pages content when being viewed.

ie:

[~dmackie]
became
[PRJ:dmackie]

and the PRJ is now shown on my page.

The move page function should be smart enough to not prefix these kinds of links with a space key because they are not space specific.

fields.description:
Comments are shown as:

[icon] Page Title > Re: Page Title

Attachments are shown as:

[icon] Page Title > attachment.pdf

This is confusing, as it gives the primary focus to the container, not the thing the search actually matched. For comments, The results will _always_ be Blah > Re: Blah, because comment titles are always the same as page titles.

We should probably put the thing that was matched first, then any container information in small-type or parens after it.

fields.description: See Screenshots
fields.summary: Heading styles for "Printable View" and "Regular View" are vastly different

fields.description:
After the upgrade, the "Backup Path" is set to custom.

(see screenshot 1)

if I disable backups, then the ui becomes boked

(see screenshot 2)

Looking in the confluence.cfg.xml file, the daily.backup.dir property is missing
fields.summary: Backup Admin config / ui borked after upgrade

fields.description: You get the following error when viewing your own user profile - and then you are left with a stray Link tag
fields.summary: View Profile borked "Fatal exception caught while processing tag,  com.opensymphony.webwork.views.jsp.ui.ComponentTag"
